result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny R Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Pay all supervision fees; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No alcohol or controlled substances

-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation
-Cooperate with agent
-Defendant to cooperate if he is subpoenaed to appear

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danny R Thomas

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Danny R Thomas in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation
-Pay all supervision fees; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to cooperate if he is subpoenaed to appear
  
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant returns to Court to address the Justice Point Violation Report.  Attorney Glover in trial in another Court and attempts to reach him were unsuccessful.  Court REMANDS defendant into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Currently scheduled sentencing date to remain.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Glover in Trial in Br. 15.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John c Glover.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties request an adjournment to allow another case to resolve.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John c Glover.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 19. Case called to address the Justice Point violation. Court admonished the defendant to comply with the conditions of Justice Point. Case remains scheduled for sentencing on 11/23/15. Case adjourned to Branch 19.
Justice Point Report - violation report - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John c Glover.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On mutual requests of parties   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John c Glover.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant is ordered by the court to provide a DNA sample.
Filed with the Court:  Victim Impact statement and Ineligible Voting Rights form
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John Glover.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has not provided an offer to defense.  Court orders State to provide an offer to defense by 8/9/15 at 5:00 pm.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint violation, received and filed.  Court to address matter at next court date in Branch 19 on 8/10/15 at 8:30 am.
Defendant ordered to have no contact with Ben B, Bradley W, Latonya V or J M.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney John c Glover.  Defendant Danny R Thomas in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant missed court on 06/11/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 07/10/15 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been discharged.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Hackbart informs court there is a conflict of interest.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.
Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court.  Irene Parthum for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Ronald Dague for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/2/15.

Motion of the defense counsel, Schwarz to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Danny R Thomas in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Danny R Thomas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
